body.p:
Mobile, Ala., Sept. 6th, 1865.
To His Excellency
The Governor of the State of Kentucky
Frankfort
Dear Sir:
I respectfully solicit, at your hands, the appointment of Commissioner of Deeds, &c., for your State, to reside in the City of Mobile, County of Mobile, State of Alabama.

I will mention in this connection, that I am now, and have been "Notary Public for said County and State, since the year 1838, being first commissioned by Arthur P. Bagby, Governor of this State; which office I have held ever since, and to the present date, the appointment having been regularly renewed by each successive Executive.
The last appointment was made by Hon. Lewis E. Parsons, Provisional Governor of this State, on the 26th day of July, 1865, for the term allowed by law, viz: three years.

I was also appointed (and held the appointment for many years) the Commissioner for your State, ^last renewal^ under date of May 2d 1859 by Governor Charles S. Morehead which reads, "during the pleasure of the Governor." This commission became void in 1861, owing to the War. I enclose you my card, and am with respect,

Truly Yours,
SIDNEY T. DOUGLAS.
Turn over
I would respectfully state for the information and satisfaction of the Executive, that I have taken and subscribed before the proper officer of this County the requisite oaths required by the law of this state, as also the laws of the United States.

Comr of Deeds
Alabama
Sidney T. Douglas
comd
9th Nov 1865
